newsitem.title: UK: Licht sees world sugar trade under 30 pct of output.
newsitem.headline: Licht sees world sugar trade under 30 pct of output.

text.p: The share of world sugar production actually traded on international markets could continue to fall this year and may slide to under 30 percent, German statistician F.O. Licht said on Thursday.
"The proportion of total sugar production traded internationally has been falling for some years," Licht said in its third estimate of the 1996/97 sugar balance.
"From 34.67 percent in 1979/80 it fell to 31.09 in 1987/88, while this year it could be as low as 29.23 percent."
White sugar had taken a steadily rising share of world trade for years but that tendency would now be sharply reversed, Licht said.
But white sugar exporters would hardly welcome the low percentage given the new refineries being established around the world, it added.
Saudi Arabia was expected to see domestically-refined sugar on its market this month while several other refineries were under construction or on the drawing board in the Middle East.
Australia had expanded refining capacity while a third refinery was to be built in Taiwan, Licht noted. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 8064
